image.altText: Police vehicle in a beach carpark with officers in the background

props.synopsis: A man in his 20s has died following a stabbing near the popular Park Beach on the NSW Mid North Coast this morning.

title.children: Surfer dies after stabbing at Coffs Harbour beach

image.altText: Two adults holding the hand of a young child

props.synopsis: The sexual assault of a 12-year-old child, cockroach infestations and a lack of access to showers and healthy food have been identified in a report into the emergency accommodation for vulnerable children in New South Wales.

title.children: Report reveals 'harrowing' conditions facing NSW children in emergency care

image.altText: An older woman with red hair wearing all black walks alongside a barrister, carrying paperwork, outside a busy courtroom.

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson's counsel tells the Federal Court that the One Nation leader was speaking rhetorically in her tweet to Greens deputy leader Mehreen Faruqi. Senator Faruqi is suing Senator Hanson under racial discrimination laws.

title.children: 'Not a nice tweet' but Hanson was speaking rhetorically in telling senator to go 'back to Pakistan', court hears

image.altText: colours and numbers light up a gaming machine

props.synopsis: An unauthorised website claims personal information of more than 1 million customer records from 14 licensed NSW clubs and one club in the ACT have been released online in a data breach.

title.children: Police identify 'persons of interest' in investigation into NSW club data breach

image.altText: Unidentified male using laptop in dark environment.

props.synopsis: A new survey finds online predators are targeting parents who share photos of their children on social media, asking them sexual questions and offering them cash for more photos.

title.children: Parents warned predators are seeking photos of their kids online

image.altText: Young girl and mother smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Single mother Jennifer Hinton spent months saving for a trip from Mackay to Melbourne with her daughter, but now it's looking unlikely that they will get a refund any time soon.

title.children: No refunds in sight for hundreds of families caught up in Bonza collapse

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Domestic violence advocates and legal experts are calling for changes to bail laws to protect women following the death of Molly Ticehurst, whose funeral was held today.

title.children: A specific change to NSW bail laws 'could save lives', domestic violence advocates and legal experts say

image.altText: A composite images of the headshots of Carr and Peters.

props.synopsis: Bob Carr says he intends to sue New Zealand Deputy Prime Minister Winston Peters over controversial remarks made on radio this morning after weeks of debate about AUKUS.

title.children: 'What on Earth does he think he's doing?' Bob Carr intends to sue NZ foreign minister over radio interview

image.altText: Three memorial crosses in the ground with a rainbow in the distance.

props.synopsis: Jailed child killer Robert Farquharson is preparing to launch a fresh appeal against his conviction. He is currently serving a life sentence for the murder of his three young sons nearly two decades ago.

title.children: Robert Farquharson drove his sons into a lake and killed them. 19 years later he is set to appeal his life sentence

image.altText: A woman and man both leaving court separately with their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: A victim of a former husband and wife who had sex with underage employees who worked at their family-owned bakery in regional South Australia in the 1980s has spoken of her "soul-destroying" suffering, saying her abusers "destroyed my adolescence".

title.children: Victim of 'soul-destroying' sexual abuse tells former bakery couple 'you're both monsters'

image.altText: Pro-Palestinian protesters on one side of a body of water and pro-Isreal on the other.

props.synopsis: A university-based pro-Palestinian protest movement that has made headlines in the United States is being mirrored in Australia.

title.children: Pro-Israel and pro-Palestinian supporters face off as Australian students join US university movement

image.altText: Graphic of Bruce Lehrmann and Lisa Wilkinson with question marks in the background

props.synopsis: Justice Michael Lee reserved his decision on costs in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case against Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson, but has ruled on some issues.

title.children: The latest Bruce Lehrmann defamation case hearing provided some answers, but key questions remain

image.altText: Jake and Callum Robinson smiling on a beach

props.synopsis: Two Perth brothers are missing on a surf trip in Mexico, with WA's premier describing their disappearance as "distressing".

title.children: Perth brothers disappear during Mexico surfing trip, with loved ones issuing desperate plea for help

image.altText: Seoul Searching

props.synopsis: South Korea once "sold off" babies to international families. Now adoptees are coming home and looking for answers.

title.children: Mary's adoptive parents thought they were rescuing an orphan. Like thousands, they were lied to

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears high-vis and a hard hat.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the number of jobs created since Labor was elected is a record for a first-term government. Is that correct? RMIT ABC Fact Check takes a look.

title.children: Fact check: Has Labor created more jobs in 21 months than any other first-term government?

image.altText: A silhouette of a couple walking on a beach, everything is red at sunset, people fishing in the background

props.synopsis: Are major renewable energy projects being unfairly targeted by federal environment laws as some groups claim? We take a look at the numbers.

title.children: The 8,000-worker town that was never built and what it tells us about the renewables vs biodiversity debate

image.altText: A wide shot of the front facade and entrance to the Midland Courthouse.

props.synopsis: A Burundi-born man and former immigration detainee is due to front court in Perth after being charged with breaching visa-mandated curfew conditions.

title.children: AFP charges ex-immigration detainee released after High Court ruling over alleged curfew breach

image.altText: A woman stands in her living room

props.synopsis: An expert panel on literacy and numeracy has made eight recommendations to the ACT government to improve the education system.

title.children: Stephanie's son wasn't taught to read properly. She's hopeful changes to the ACT education system will help others

image.altText: Rolfe 2

props.synopsis: Lawyers for former constable Zachary Rolfe lose their bid to keep confidential 10 pages of handwritten notes he used during evidence at the Kumanjayi Walker inquest.

title.children: Rolfe ordered to hand over notes used in evidence referencing NT police racism, sexism

image.altText: Nickelodeon producer Dan Schneider on stage with an award surrounded by people

props.synopsis: Former Nickelodeon producer Dan Schneider says he's suing the producers behind the docuseries Quiet on Set, which accused him of inappropriate behaviour on his TV shows.

title.children: 'It was a hit job': Nickelodeon show creator Dan Schneider sues Quiet on Set producers for defamation

image.altText: A man in a suit rests his hand on his chest, standing in front of Solomon Island and China flags.

props.synopsis: Former foreign minister and diplomat Jeremiah Manele has been elected as the new prime minister of Solomon Islands — and he's expected to maintain close ties with China.

title.children: Solomon Islands has a new PM — and some say he will 'lower the temperature'

image.altText: a close up photo of a sign that says how many more women

props.synopsis: The federal government has committed to permanent funding to help women escape violence and online measures including an age verification trial to block children accessing pornography. But not everyone is convinced those measures will work.

title.children: Domestic violence survivors feeling 'let down' by '$925 million bandaid'

image.altText: Man with walker on footpath with woman on his right hand side, greenery in backdrop

props.synopsis: Les Brookfield has walked 100 parkruns and is determined to keep exercising thanks to the health and social benefits he notices from the activity.

title.children: Community cheers on 94-year-old parkrun member as popularity of running clubs grows

image.altText: A man hugs a small alligator to his chest

props.synopsis: Wally's owner Joie Henney says his pet went missing while on vacation and he fears the reptile had been stolen by pranksters, then set free in the wild.

title.children: Wally the emotional support alligator is missing, suspected stolen and set free in the wild

image.altText: AFL footballer Hamish Brayshaw, receiving a hand pass, during a training session

props.synopsis: Former AFL footballer Hamish Brayshaw pens an open letter to the AFL, lamenting the inconsistency in the League's tribunal and match review panel for "single-handedly destroying the game".

title.children: Brayshaw pens open letter to AFL accusing its tribunal of lacking consistency

image.altText: Amy Sayer in action for the Matildas

props.synopsis: Young gun Amy Sayer is the latest Matildas player who will be sidelined for the upcoming Olympics after she was helped off the pitch with a ruptured ACL while playing for her club side.

title.children: 'An upsetting blow': Another Matildas star to miss Olympics as injury curse continues

image.altText: A stock market watcher stands in front of an ASX board.

props.synopsis: NAB says its half-year profit fell 11.9 per cent from intense competition in the lending industry, while the Australian share market is up at midday after the US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell indicates a US rate hike is unlikely. Follow live.

title.children: NAB half-year profit drops 11.9pc, ASX up at lunch after Federal Reserve indicates US rate hike is 'unlikely'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Six restaurants and two bars racked up around $20 million in debt over a couple of years
Bunnings to 'learn from' complaints from suppliers: CEO
Rio copper business to 'double' this decade: CEO

image.altText: Tools and wood lie on a broken church floor

props.synopsis: An increasing number of do-it-yourself renovations by landlords in the rental market has raised concerns around what a lack of policing could mean for renters if the work is not done correctly.

title.children: Tenants enduring shoddy home repairs as DIY trend leads to 'landlord specials'

image.altText: A man celebrates a UFC victory

props.synopsis: After less than a year in the UFC and just three fights, Steve Erceg will have a shot at a world title. Can he become Australia's newest UFC champion?

title.children: After less than a year in the game, Australian Steve Erceg will fight for a world title at UFC 301

image.altText: A man in a grey polo backlit and behind him are a couple of houseboats

props.synopsis: A retiree says NSW's blanket ban on houseboat living should be reviewed as he enjoys a "cheap, comfortable" way of life.

title.children: River life a natural progression for retiree in call for end to houseboat living ban

image.altText: Actors Chris Hemsworth and Anya Taylor-Joy smile. Backdrop shows film title 'Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga'.

props.synopsis: The beloved blockbuster series Mad Max is back with a fifth instalment — Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga. News Breakfast sat down with Chris Hemsworth, Anya Taylor-Joy and George Miller to hear how it came together.

title.children: 'Every Australian actor's dream': Chris Hemsworth relishes the chance to star in Mad Max film

image.altText: A row of armoured vehicles travels along dry grassland

props.synopsis: Former military and intelligence leaders, including the former chief of Australia's Defence Force, say the government has "astonishingly" forgotten the risk of climate change in its defence strategy.

title.children: Former defence chief says government 'doesn't understand' climate change risk to Australia's security

image.altText: Two soldiers stand next a giant green tank.

props.synopsis: The US says it is "over 50 per cent complete" with getting the pier set up several miles off the Gaza coast.

title.children: US builds pier to provide aid to Gaza — here's how it will work

image.altText: A film still of Nicholas Galitzine, 29, and Anne Hathaway, 41, who is smiling brightly. They're boarding a private plane.

props.synopsis: Anne Hathaway's steamy new film explores the age-gap relationship between a single mum and a much younger boy-band heart throb.

title.children: Anne Hathaway's The Idea of You is ripe with steamy romps, but is it any good?
